comments.body: I think the get_dlp_job() here should better take a `retry` parameter too. Otherwise, this creating dlp job operation could easily fail if any one of such getting status API calls returns a retryable error.

Each method in the Google Cloud Python API has a separate repeat configuration.
https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-python/blob/master/dlp/google/cloud/dlp_v2/gapic/dlp_service_client.py#L1941
https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-python/blob/master/dlp/google/cloud/dlp_v2/gapic/dlp_service_client_config.py#L105-L109
I think that the introduction of additional configuration can cause confusion and inconsistencies. We do not provide configuration options in other operators.  My team is planning to deal with this problem in this Q. Consequence will allow us to introduce changes more quickly to more operators.
@mik-laj Okay. So before you guys come up a solution for this, we just leave it as it is by using default configurations for this case at this moment, is that correct?

For me , it is correct. 
@zzlbuaa WDYT?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +228,232 @@
        while wait_until_finished:
            job = self.get_dlp_job(
                dlp_job_id=job_name,
                project_id=project_id)

comments.body: Is not it worth to read the project id from the connection configuration?
